page.title: 12HOUSING
page.content: IN THE MAIN STREET OF THE VILLAGE THE HOUSES ARE LARGELY PRIVATELY OWNED AND OCCUPIED, ONLY A FEW BEING TIED DWELLINGS, AND A HANDFUL PRIVATELY RENTED. THE STYLES OF THE HOUSES VARY FROM THE TIMBER FRAMED HOUSES BUILT SINCE THE BURNING OF THE VILLAGE BY THE FRENCH IN 138O TO SOME MODERN PSEUDO GEORGIAN BUILDINGS; WITH EXAMPLES OF THE MAIN STYLES OF THE INTERVENING PERIOD, THERE ARE TWO SMALL ESTATES OWNED BY THE LOCAL AUTHORITY. A FEW HOUSES HAVE BEEN PURCHASED BY THEIR OCCUPANTS BUT THE MAJORITY REMAIN RENTED.ONE SUCH ESTATE IS SITUATED AT THE EAST END OF THE VILLAGE PROPER, WHILST ANOTHER ESTATE, WHICH INCLUDES BUNGALOWS FOR SENIOR CITIZENS, IS A QUARTER OF A MILE FURTHER EAST AT 'THE HEATH'.
